Articles.Title: People Sabotaging Tesla Cars May Go To Jail For Up To 20 Years: Donald Trump
Articles.Summary: US President Donald Trump stated that individuals caught sabotaging Tesla vehicles could face up to 20 years in jail. This announcement followed US Attorney General Pam Bondi's condemnation of violent attacks on Tesla property, labeling them as 'domestic terrorism.' Bondi vowed severe consequences for perpetrators and those funding these crimes. The statement comes after incidents involving damaged Tesla vehicles, vandalism at dealerships and charging stations, and protests following Elon Musk's appointment to a government role. The US Department of Defence is also set to brief Musk on potential war plans with China.

Articles.Title: Tesla Takedown Movement
Articles.Summary: This Newsx article discusses the 'Tesla Takedown Movement' which is fueled by backlash against Elon Musk's role in government. Demonstrations have occurred at nearly 90 Tesla showrooms across the United States for five consecutive weeks. The protests are linked to Musk's leadership of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and its impact on federal government staffing and budgets. The article highlights the growing opposition to Musk's involvement in governmental affairs and its subsequent effect on his company, Tesla.

Articles.Title: tesla protests
Articles.Summary: This Newsx article centers on Tesla protests related to Elon Musk's leadership within the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). The protests stem from Musk's involvement in cutting federal government staffing and budgets, which has generated widespread opposition. Demonstrations have taken place at approximately 90 Tesla showrooms throughout the United States for the past five weeks. The article underscores the ongoing and organized resistance against Tesla, driven by Musk's controversial government role.

Articles.Title: Tesla dealerships under attack in US as Musk takes up vital role under Trump administration
Articles.Summary: Tesla dealerships are facing attacks across the US and overseas following Elon Musk's appointment to a vital role under the Trump administration. Incidents include arson, vandalism, and Molotov cocktail attacks. Experts suggest these attacks are linked to Musk's oversight of the Department of Government Efficiency. Protests have also been organized, and some owners have vowed to sell their vehicles. Law enforcement is investigating these incidents, with some perpetrators facing charges related to domestic extremism.

Articles.Title: Several Tesla vehicles torched in Las Vegas; police probe possible arson
Articles.Summary: Authorities are investigating a possible arson attack at a Tesla service center in Las Vegas, Nevada, where multiple vehicles were set on fire. The incident occurred in the early hours of Tuesday. The Tesla service center was also vandalized with graffiti. This is the latest in a series of attacks against the electric vehicle maker's property. The Metropolitan Police Department is currently investigating the incident.

Articles.Title: ‘Tesla Takedown’: How Elon Musk’s Trump alliance is triggering backlash
Articles.Summary: Al Jazeera's podcast explores the backlash against Elon Musk due to his association with Donald Trump. The 'Tesla Takedown' movement, including boycotts, protests, and attacks, has caused Tesla's stock to plummet. The US Attorney General labeled the attacks as 'domestic terrorism.' The podcast examines the reasons behind this fallout and its potential impact on Tesla. The episode includes various production credits and contact information for Al Jazeera English.

Final Sentiment Analysis: Overall, the sentiment surrounding Tesla is negative due to the ongoing attacks on its properties and the backlash against Elon Musk's political involvement. Articles highlight vandalism, arson, and protests linked to Musk's role in government and his association with controversial figures. This negative press has the potential to damage Tesla's brand reputation, deter customers, and impact its stock value, although some articles simply present neutral financial data. The dominant narrative reflects concerns about the company's stability and future prospects amid these challenges, creating uncertainty in the market and affecting investor confidence. This could lead to decreased sales and a decline in market share for Tesla.
